subject: Re: [junit] Re: Test Names and rerunning Test instances for Parameterized Tests
msgSnippet: ... Hmmm... I ll have to dig into the code and see how it does it. In the example I posted, there is no obvious way of determining the parameter value (it
messageBody:
On 21/10/05, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
> Just FYI,
>
> The RemoteTestRunner in Eclipse does not keep old Test objects around to
> be re-run--when run in keepalive mode, it is still using the test class
> and String constructor argument to create a new Test object. I'm not
> aware of any JUnit test runner that actually calls a test method on any
> test class instance twice: apparently an outgrowth of the
> one-object-per-test philosophy. The win in keepalive mode is any
> Eclipse start-up time (for plug-in tests) and classloading time is
> passed up on the rerun.

Hmmm... I'll have to dig into the code and see how it does it. In the
example I posted, there is no obvious way of determining the parameter
value (it doesn't match the test's name property, nor do I invoke the
parent constructor)

--
"Software is too expensive to build cheaply"
Robert Watkins http://twasink.net/ robertdw@...
